metadata.Title: CVE-2017-1000456 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
freedesktop.org libpoppler 0.60.1 fails to validate boundaries in TextPool::addWord, leading to overflow in subsequent calculations.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000456` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9
libpoppler44 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9
poppler-utils - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: poppler package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9').
